Have you considered proposal 4 (i) in the light of most-favoured nation clauses, e.g., that in Convention with France of 1903 ? 4 (j) suggests two questions (i) India may before long be under obligation to prohibit,or limit despatch of opium or charas to all countries that normally import them; (ii) is it desirable to leave way open for unlimited exports from Afghanistan to any other countries ? Possible alternative might be to substitute for last sentence " provided that under regulations at the time in force, export of an equal quantity/of Indian opium or charas to the importing country would be permissible."
